title.value: Video Killed the HD-Map: Predicting Multi-Agent Behavior Directly From Aerial Images
title.justification: It is the title of the paper.
title.quote: Video Killed the HD-Map: Predicting Multi-Agent Behavior Directly From Aerial Images

extractions.description: This paper introduces an aerial image-based map (AIM) representation that requires minimal annotation and provides rich road context information for multi-agent behavior modeling in autonomous driving. It integrates AIM into a differentiable driving simulator and demonstrates competitive multi-agent trajectory prediction performance compared to high-definition maps.

type.justification: The paper conducts experiments and provides evaluation metrics for multi-agent trajectory prediction using the AIM representation.
type.quote: We evaluate multi-agent trajectory prediction using the AIM by incorporating it into a differentiable driving simulator as an image-texture-based differentiable rendering module.

name.justification: The paper leverages deep learning models and techniques for multi-agent trajectory prediction.
name.quote: Recent studies have emphasized the use of learned models to generate more realistic behavior for controlled agents like pedestrians and surrounding vehicles.

name.justification: The paper focuses on predicting future trajectories of multiple traffic agents using AIM representation.
name.quote: In this study, we investigate the performance of behavioral models learned using aerial imagery instead of HD maps... We evaluate multi-agent trajectory prediction using the AIM...

name.justification: A variant of the ITRA model that uses aerial image-based map (AIM) for multi-agent trajectory prediction.
name.quote: ITRA-AIM demonstrates competitive performance compared to ITRA-HDM

name.justification: A variant of the ITRA model that uses high-definition maps (HDM) for multi-agent trajectory prediction.
name.quote: ITRA-AIM demonstrates competitive performance compared to ITRA-HDM

name.justification: The dataset is used for multi-agent behavior modeling and provides sensory data for agent tracks.
name.quote: Typically, learning behavior models requires data consisting of the high-definition (HD) map for the given location and extracted agent tracks.

name.justification: This dataset is similar to the one recorded using a drone from a bird’s-eye view in the study.
name.quote: We record a dataset of human behavior in traffic scenes with a drone from a bird’s-eye view, in a manner similar to [11]

name.justification: The dataset is used to test the flexibility of the AIM representation.
name.quote: We acquired an aerial image from Bing aerial imagery of the same location as Fig. 4d to construct a larger AIM.

name.justification: PyTorch is used as the deep learning framework for the implementation of models.
name.quote: Our image-texture-based differentiable rendering module is designed to be differentiable and efficient as it supports rendering in batch mode using PyTorch.

name.justification: PyTorch3D is used for implementing the differentiable rendering module.
name.quote: We incorporate AIM into a differentiable simulator by implementing a custom differentiable renderer with PyTorch3D.
